_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2013 14:48:04 using v0.9
title: How has the proportion of carers feeling involved varied by region?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of carers who always or usually feel involved or consulted decreased by 5.7% from 2009/10 to 2012/13 in England. If we look at this by region, London had the lowest proportion of carers (65.9%) who always or usually felt involved or consulted. This is 13.4% below the highest seen in the North East and 6.9% below the national average of 72.8%.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre,  Personal Social Services Survey of Adult Carers in England
